isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT

svcproc.title: MAINSHAFT

figure.caption: Figure 172. Mainshaft

caution.para: Use the correct snap ring in the gears or the transmissions will not operate correctly. Transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below, use part number 1697779C1. Transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, use part number 1697778C1.

step1.para: If removed, install the snap rings in the gears ( Figure 173).

figure.caption: Figure 173. If Removed, Install Snap Rings in Gears

warning.para: When using a hammer and steel drift, wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition to prevent serious personal injury.

step1.para: If removed, use a hammer and steel drift to install a new roll pin (Figure 174).

figure.caption: Figure 174. If Removed, Install New Roll Pin

step1.para: Lubricate all the parts of the mainshaft with same oil used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubricants.
Install the mainshaft in a vise with brass jaws. Make sure the slot for the key is toward you.

note.para: Use the correct selective washer. Do not mix washers or the transmission will not operate correctly.

step1.para: Choose the correct selective thrust washer for the third or overdrive gear.

step2.para: If the selective washers ARE NOT REPLACED, use the original washers.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below, use a 5.60 mm (0.220 inch) washer.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, use a 7.00 mm (0.275 inch) washer.

step1.para: Install the selective washer for third or overdrive gear on the shaft. Make sure the smooth side is toward you (Figure 175).

figure.caption: Figure 175. Install Selective Washer For Third or Overdrive Gear

step1.para: Slide the washer to the groove above the roll pin.
Move the washer so that the teeth of the washer are directly over the splines of the shaft. The washer must not slide down the shaft.

note.para: The key will be removed and installed during this procedure. Mark the groove where the roll pin is installed.

step1.para: Install the key in the slot where the roll pin is installed. Make sure the key touches the roll pin (Figure 176).
Install the spacer on top of the washer (Figure 176).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Install Key and Spacer

step1.para: Install the third or overdrive gear on the shaft. Make sure the splines in the gear engage teeth on the spacer and the snap ring is against the spacer (Figure 177).

figure.caption: Figure 177. Install Third or Overdrive Gear

step1.para: Install the second or third gear. Make sure the snap ring is toward the third or overdrive gear (Figure 178).
Install a spacer. Make sure the teeth of the spacer engage the splines of the gear ( Figure 178).

figure.caption: Figure 178. Install Second or Third Gear and Spacer

caution.para: Make sure the selective washers do not move when the key is removed. If the washers move, the gears will fall and the assembly must be disassembled and assembled.

step1.para: Remove the key.
Choose the correct selective thrust washer for the second or third gear.

step2.para: If the selective washers ARE NOT REPLACED, use the original washers.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below, use a 5.50 mm (0.216 inch) washer.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, use a 6.91 mm (0.272 inch) washer.

step1.para: Install the washer on the shaft. Make sure the chamfered side with the dot is toward you ( Figure 179).
Slide the washer to the second groove above the roll pin.
Move the washer so that the teeth of the washer are directly over the splines of the shaft. The washer must not slide down the shaft.
If necessary, put a small screwdriver in the dot to move the washer (Figure 179)

figure.caption: Figure 179. Install Washer on Shaft

step1.para: Put two screwdrivers across from each other between the gears (Figure 180).
Lightly push on the screwdrivers to evenly spread the gears. Make sure the gears are parallel to each other ( Figure 180).

note.para: Do not push on the screwdrivers when the feeler gauges are installed.

figure.caption: Figure 180. Push on Screwdrivers to Evenly Spread Gears

step1.para: Put two small feeler gauges between the hubs. Each feeler gauge must be opposite the other. The clearance must be 0.152 to 0.305 mm (0.006 to 0.012 inch) (Figure 181).

figure.caption: Figure 181. Clearance Must be 0.006 to 0.012 Inch

step1.para: If the clearance is less than 0.152 mm (0.006 inch), install a thinner selective thrust washer in the second or third gear.
If the clearance is more than 0.305 mm (0.012 inch), install a thicker selective thrust washer.

note.para: Three sizes of thrust washers are available.

svcproc.para: For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below, the sizes are: 5.50, 5.60 and 5.70 mm (0.216, 0.220 and 0.224 inch).
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, the sizes are: 6.90, 7.00 and 7.10 mm (0.272, 0.275 and 0.279 inch).

step1.para: Remove the screwdrivers and feeler gauges.
Install the sliding collar. Make sure the slot in the collar is installed over the key ( Figure 182).

figure.caption: Figure 182. Install Sliding Collar

note.para: Use the correct selective washer. Do not mix washers or the transmission will not operate correctly.

step1.para: Choose the correct selective thrust washer for the first or second gear.

step2.para: If the selective washers ARE NOT REPLACED, use the original washers.
If the selective washers ARE REPLACED, install medium size washer.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below use a 5.60 mm (0.220 inch) washer.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, use a 7.00 mm (0.275 inch) washer.

step1.para: Remove the key. Install selective thrust washer for first or second gear on the shaft (Figure 183). Make sure the smooth side is toward you.

figure.caption: Figure 183. Install Selective Thrust Washer for First or Second Gear

step1.para: Slide the washer to the third groove above the roll pin.
Move the washer so that the teeth of the washer are directly over the splines of the shaft. The washer must not slide down the shaft.
Install the key in the slot where the roll pin is installed. The key must touch the roll pin ( Figure 184).
Install the spacer on top of the washer ( Figure 184).

figure.caption: Figure 184. Install Key and Spacer

step1.para: Install the first or second gear on the shaft. Make sure the splines of the gear engage the teeth on the spacer and the snap ring is against the spacer ( Figure 185).

figure.caption: Figure 185. Install First or Second Gear

step1.para: Install the low or first gear. Make sure the snap ring is toward the first or second gear ( Figure 186).
Install a spacer. Make sure the teeth of the spacer engage the splines of the gear ( Figure 186).

figure.caption: Figure 186. Install Low or First Gear and Spacer

caution.para: Make sure the selective washers do not move when the key is removed. If the washers move, the gears will fall and the assembly must be disassembled and assembled.

step1.para: Remove the key.
Choose the correct selective thrust washer for the low or first gear.

step2.para: If the selective washers ARE NOT REPLACED, use the original washers.
If the selective washers ARE REPLACED, install the thinnest size of washer.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below, use a 5.50 mm (0.216 inch) washer.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, use a 6.90 mm (0.272 inch) washer.

step1.para: Install the selective washer for the low or first gear on the shaft. Make sure the chamfered side with the dot is toward you ( Figure 187).

figure.caption: Figure 187. Install Selective Washer for Low or First Gear

step1.para: Slide the washer to the fourth groove above the roll pin.
Move the washer so that the teeth of the washer are directly over the splines of the shaft. The washer must not slide down the shaft.
If necessary, put a small screwdriver in the dot on the washer to move the washer ( Figure 187).
Put two screwdrivers across from each other between the first and low or the second and the first gears ( Figure 188).
Lightly push on the screwdrivers to evenly spread the gears. Make sure the gears are parallel ( Figure 188).

figure.caption: Figure 188. Lightly Push on Screwdrivers to Evenly Spread Gears

note.para: Do not push on the screwdrivers when the feeler gauges are installed.

step1.para: Put two feeler gauges between the hubs. Each feeler gauge must be opposite the other. The clearance must be 0.152 to 0.305 mm (0.006 to 0.012 inch) ( Figure 189).

figure.caption: Figure 189. Put Two Feeler Gauges Between Hubs

step1.para: If the clearance is less than 0.152 mm (0.006 inch), install a thinner selective washer.
If the clearance is more than 0.305 mm (0.012 inch), install a thicker selective thrust washer.

note.para: Three sizes of thrust washers are available.

svcproc.para: For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below, the sizes are: 5.50, 5.60 and 5.70 mm (0.216, 0.220 and 0.224 inch).
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, the sizes are: 6.90, 7.00 and 7.10 mm (0.272, 0.275 and 0.279 inch).

step1.para: Remove the screwdrivers and feeler gauges.
Install the sliding collar on the shaft. Make sure the slot in the collar is installed over the key ( Figure 190).

figure.caption: Figure 190. Install Sliding Collar

note.para: Use the correct selective washer. Do not mix washers or the transmission will not operate correctly.

step1.para: Choose the correct selective thrust washer for the reverse gear.

step2.para: If the selective washers ARE NOT REPLACED, use the original washers.
If the selective washers ARE REPLACED, install the medium size washer.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below, use a 5.60 mm (0.220 inch) washer.
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, use a 7.00 mm (0.275 inch) washer.

step1.para: Remove the key. Install the selective thrust washer for the reverse gear ( Figure 191). Make sure the smooth side is toward you.

figure.caption: Figure 191. Install Selective Thrust Washer for Reverse Gear

step1.para: Slide the washer to the fifth groove above the roll pin.
Move the washer so that the teeth of the washer are directly over the splines of the shaft. The washer must not slide down the shaft.
Install the key in the slot where the roll pin is installed. Make sure the key touches the roll pin ( Figure 192).

figure.caption: Figure 192. Install Key in Slot

step1.para: Install the spacer on top of the washer ( Figure 193).

figure.caption: Figure 193. Install Spacer on Top of Washer

step1.para: Install the reverse gear on the shaft. Make sure the splines in the gear engage the teeth in the spacer and the snap ring is against the spacer (Figure 194).

figure.caption: Figure 194. Install Reverse Gear

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the second snap ring groove from the top of the mainshaft. Make sure the opening of the snap ring is opposite (180 degrees) the key ( Figure 195).

figure.caption: Figure 195. Install Snap Ring in Second Snap Ring Groove
Figure 196. Install Thrust Washer for Auxiliary Drive Gear

step1.para: Install the auxiliary drive gear assembly on the mainshaft. Make sure the bearing is installed toward the mainshaft.
Install the snap ring that fastens the auxiliary drive gear to the mainshaft ( Figure 197).

figure.caption: Figure 197. Install Snap Ring That Fastens Auxiliary Drive Gear to Mainshaft

step1.para: Lift on the auxiliary drive gear and push on the reverse gear. Make sure the auxiliary drive gear is parallel to the reverse gear. Make sure the snap rings are correctly installed ( Figure 198).

figure.caption: Figure 198. Lift Auxiliary Drive Gear

step1.para: Put two feeler gauges between the hubs. The clearance must be 0.152 to 0.305 mm (0.006 to 0.012 inch) ( Figure 199).

figure.caption: Figure 199. Put Two Feeler Gauges Between Hubs

step1.para: If the clearance is less than 0.152 mm (0.006 inch), install a thinner selective washer in the reverse gear.
If the clearance is more than 0.305 mm (0.012 inch), install a thicker selective washer in the reverse gear.

note.para: Three sizes of thrust washers are available.

svcproc.para: For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021753 and below, the sizes are: 5.50, 5.60 and 5.70 mm (0.216, 0.220 and 0.224 inch).
For transmissions with serial numbers LB93021754 and above, the sizes are: 6.90, 7.00 and 7.10 mm (0.272, 0.275 and 0.279 inch).

step1.para: Remove the screwdrivers and feeler gauges.

caution.para: Be careful when moving the mainshaft assembly. The movement of the gears can damage the washers.

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft assembly from the vise.
Install the sliding collar over the roll pin on the top of the mainshaft.
